positive_phenotypes: intermittent dystonic posturing of all extremities
motor complications of more advanced PD including peak-dose and wearing-off phenomena with disabling retrocollic dystonic spasms

explanation.num_tested_probands: The use of 'the case' suggests a single proband was tested.
explanation.num_positive_het_probands: The proband is described as having 'compound heterozygous mutations in WARS2,' which implies that he is not a simple heterozygote but rather has two different mutations, one on each allele of the gene.
explanation.positive_phenotypes: Phenotypes are explicitly mentioned as 'infantile-onset, Levodopa-responsive Parkinsonism at the age of 2 years.' Additional phenotypes are inferred from the detailed clinical description.
explanation.num_compound_or_double_hets: Since the text refers to 'the case of a 17-year-old boy' with compound heterozygous mutations, it can be inferred that there is one individual who is a compound heterozygote.
